In making modifications to their Personal Data, Data Subjects must provide only truthful, complete, and accurate information.

Except as otherwise provided herein, Modern Hire discloses Personal Information only to Third Parties who reasonably need to know such data and not for other purposes.
If a Modern Hire business line or the entire business, or a substantial portion thereof, is acquired or transferred, whether by merger, consolidation or purchase of a substantial portion of assets, Modern Hire may disclose and transfer Users' Personal Data to the acquiring third party.
Modern Hire may also disclose Personal Data and aggregate anonymous information to those businesses, divisions, and units that are affiliated with Modern Hire.
Modern Hire may also disclose Users' Personal Data to third parties when we believe, in good faith and in our sole discretion, that such disclosure is reasonably necessary to (a) enforce or apply the terms and conditions of the Services; (b) comply with legal or regulatory requirements; (c) protect the rights, property or safety of us, our users or other third parties; or (d) prevent a crime or protect national security.
Modern Hire may disclose Personal Data and aggregate anonymous information to other users of the Services (for example, information of Candidates to Employers) and to companies, agents, contractors, or others engaged to perform functions on Modern Hire's behalf.

text: For example, Modern Hire may collect system-related information to be used for system administration purposes, to help diagnose problems, to monitor traffic patterns, to determine which services are used most frequently and to assess site usage.
